intro: Coccoloba scrobiculata, commonly known as the roughleaf poinsettia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with serrated edges and its showy, red bracts that resemble flowers. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage and seasonal color changes. Coccoloba scrobiculata plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
